alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 3:23PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California... West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. .Mild temperatures will continue to keep flows high along the West Walker River including Walker River Canyon. For the West Walker Above Topaz Lake...including Little Walker and Coleville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding of lowlands pasture & rural roads in West Walker River Canyon and Antelope Valley including Walker, Coleville and Topaz California. Roughly similar to late May 2005, and slightly below peaks of June 2010 and May 2006. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 6.0 feet late Sunday evening. It will rise above flood stage late Sunday evening. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov.
